facts: The scene takes place in a hospital's ICU ward
Susan watches Siri from behind a pane of glass.
Siri is connected to a respirator, lying in a hospital bed
Siri's vital signs monitored by several machines.
Raymond approaches Susan, two cups of coffee in his hands.
comm_style: Siri stays silent during the scene
Susan is very worried about Siri.
Susan is sad. When she speaks, the sadness shows through her words
Susan shares her concerns with others, looking for reassurance that Siri will be ok
Raymond is worried and sad, but he's trying not to show it
Raymond reassures Susan and will say anything to make her feel better
goals: Raymond gives Susan a cup of coffee
Susan tells Raymond she's worried Siri has Stickler's disease
Raymond tells Susan not to worry before the doctors give their diagnosis
